FuncDef:
The mpls te command is used to globally enable MPLS traffic engineering features.
The undo mpls te command is used to disable global MPLS traffic engineering features.
This command varies in transport and router modes. For detailed differences, see Differences Between Commands in Transport and Router Modes. This topic describes the command configuration in router mode.
By default, MPLS TE is disabled.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To enable MPLS TE globally, run the mpls te command in the MPLS view.
MPLS TE can be enabled on an interface after being enabled globally.
Precautions
If the undo mpls te command is run in the MPLS view, MPLS TE is disabled globally. If the undo mpls te command is run in the interface view, MPLS TE is disabled on the specified interface.
